hello.intro: Spring returns to the desert with Desert Spring Series, March 18–29, a fast two‑week slate that resets the cadence after winter runs. On the official [Desert Spring Series](https://deserthorsepark.com/events/) calendar, early‑week qualifiers build into weekend finales, while polished national classes keep pace in parallel rings. At [Desert International Horse Park](https://deserthorsepark.com/), palm‑lined arenas sit against purple mountain backdrops, with clean sightlines, all‑weather footing, and wide bridle paths that keep traffic flowing between barns and schooling. Thermal, CA stays practical and close‑in so energy stays on the board, not the drive. Save your spring focus for the ring here.

stay.title: Sleep Close to DIHP
stay.paragraph: Aim for zero‑friction mornings and quiet recovery at night. Keep drives short, layouts walkable, and service predictable so debriefs stay crisp between trips. **La Quinta Resort & Club** blends roomy casitas and garden paths for low‑key resets, while **Renaissance Esmeralda** adds polished service and dependable late‑return windows when classes run long. Also consider: [Holiday Inn Express & Suites](https://www.ihg.com/holidayinnexpress/hotels/us/en/indio/pspny/hoteldetail); [JW Marriott Desert Springs](https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/pspdt-jw-marriott-desert-springs-resort-and-spa/overview/). Spectator tip: resort grounds at La Quinta and Esmeralda make easy viewing breaks for non‑riders.

dine.title: Eat Efficiently Nearby
dine.paragraph: Plan food like gear: predictable, close, and timed to your blocks so warm‑ups and walks never slip. For quick greens, wraps, and the famous date shake, **The Cafe at Shields Date Garden** is an easy midday reset; when the board tightens, **Heirloom Craft Kitchen** stays steady with bowls and sandwiches. After late classes, **Lavender Bistro** and **Arnold Palmer’s Restaurant** deliver a calm, seated finish, and **LG’s Prime Steakhouse** keeps steak night simple. Also consider: [Tack Room Tavern](https://www.tackroomtavern.com); [Mario’s Italian Cafe](http://mariositalianrestaurants.com). Spectator tip: patios at Lavender and Heirloom make it easy to review rounds without crowd noise.
dine.spectator_tip: Outdoor tables help debriefs run smoothly when teams stretch to a second seating.

locale.title: Desert Downtime, Minutes Away
locale.paragraph: Between rounds, use small windows for recovery and clear air. Short drives from Thermal open mountain views, quiet desert streets, and simple coffee stops; keep mid‑day breaks light—one stroll, one errand—then save longer detours for an off‑day. Reset near the venue so attention stays on your card, not the clock. Also consider: [Desert International Horse Park](https://deserthorsepark.com/); [Events](https://deserthorsepark.com/events/).

essentials.title: Barn Basics On Hand
essentials.paragraph: Lock down staples so mornings stay clear and the barn runs without questions. **Ralphs** covers groceries and ice, **CVS Pharmacy** handles meds and tape, and on‑grounds vendors at DIHP stock feed, bedding, and tack when shows are live; wheels stay straightforward with **Enterprise Rent‑A‑Car** for SUVs and **Dever, Inc.** for golf carts with delivery. Also consider: [Ralphs](https://www.ralphs.com); [CVS Pharmacy](https://www.cvs.com).
